H0.text: when did chicano studies become major studies programs on college campuses. 1968

H1.text: when did chicano studies become major studies programs on college campuses. 1970

H2.text: when did chicano studies become major studies programs on college campuses. 1975

H3.text: when did chicano studies become major studies programs on college campuses. 1972

A4.text: Through these conferences and the many other initiatives organized by Chicano students and educators, many Chicano studies programs were in place at major universities by 1975.

A5.text: Further support for Chicano studies came in the form of the National Association of Chicana and Chicano Studies (NACCS) which was created in 1972 in San Antonio, Texas.

A6.text: Between 1969 and 1971, MECHA grew rapidly in California with major centers of activism on campuses in southern California.

A7.text: A map of Chicano press across the country from 1969 to 1970 based on serial listings collected by the University of California Libraries.
